title: Error when loading hg38 reference genome
body:
## Bug description

When running the following command I get an error message:

`CHIPIN_normalize(path_to_bw=pathToFiles, type_norm="quantile", RPKM=pathToRPKMfile, sample_name=sampleName, output_dir=outputFolder, organism="hg38")`

> Error in CHIPIN_normalize(path_to_bw = bw_path, type_norm = "quantile",  : 
  object 'TSS_hg38' not found

## Proposed solution
When loading `data("TSS_hg38")` the resulting dataframe is called `hg38TSS` instead of `TSS_hg38`. Changing the following lines in the `functions_CHIPIN.R` file solved the problem for me.

line 1925:  from `D_TSS=TSS_hg38` into `D_TSS=hg38TSS`
line 2074: from `D_TSS=TSS_hg38` into `D_TSS=hg38TSS`

## Session Info


R version 3.6.3 (2020-02-29)
Platform: x86_64-apple-darwin15.6.0 (64-bit)
Running under: macOS  10.16

body:

Error: Failed to install 'CHIPIN' from GitHub:

In addition: Warning message:
package ‘tiger’ is not available for this version of R

Tiger was removed from CRAN repository.   https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tiger/index.html

title: how to adapt this for analysis of paired-end reads with different fragment lengths (ChIP, INPUT)
body:
In my project, I need to analyse coverage of ChIP-seq signal from two ranges of fragment lengths. I bin reads into smallBin (30-150bp) and bigBin (150-300 bp).  Relative proportion of reads in these bins has to be preserved in order to be of any use to my question. 

What do you suggest I should do? 

Thanks

title: Organisms and Galaxy package
body:
Hi, 

Thanks for developing this great normalization technique!

I have two questions:

- Do you update the package concerning the available reference genomes? You offer mm9 and mm10, but we want to use the latest mm39.
- Have you written a Galaxy wrapper for CHIPIN?

Thanks and best,

Joachim

title: error message relating to mat.gz files
body:
When running CHIPIN I get the following error which may be a bug in the code as it's looking for a "...mat.mat.gz" file:

  cannot open file '/lustre/projects/Research_Project-MRC190311/ATACSeq/youthgems_aut/bigwigs/dups_removed/chipin/neun/11290_0629FC_NEUN_230515_S44_filt.nodup.mat.mat.gz': No such file or directory
Execution halted

title: Error message
body:
In our group we are getting the following error when trying to run CHIPIN: 

Error in normalize.quantiles(dataToNormHUGE_ordered_grouped, copy = TRUE) :

Calls: CHIPIN_normalize -> quantile_norm -> normalize.quantiles
